lead_paragraph: Rockies Manager Clint Hurdle anointed Jeff Baker as his second baseman last week. And why not? Baker hit .380 over a three-week period and, Hurdle said, his defense improved, pushing Clint Barmes to the bench. But Baker is the epitome of a Coors Field creation. Through Friday, he had hit .341 at home with six homers but just .229 on the road with two homers. Barmes had hit nearly 30 points higher on the road.
